content.description:
Thin seam in between baby bear and goldylocks.  Near the middle right section of the wall.

Easy (er) climbing leads to the bouldering business.  A one or two move wonder.  Perhaps a shade easier if you are tall...
content.protection: Pros okay but most will TR.

content.description: This severe overhanging dihedral is one of the most obvious lines on the Goldilocks Wall. Follow the obvious right leaning dihedral through tricky and powerful lye backs and finger locks. This line was put up first ascent on a lead onsight which is rare today, because most people would rather toprope it.
content.protection:
This dihedral takes small tcu's and nuts plus a few larger cams for the top.

There is a bolted anchor which u can easily access from walking to the top of the cliff.
content.location: Papa Bear is located to the left of baby bear and to the right of mama bear.

content.description:
An excellent technical climb up the broken cracks on the right of the main wall.

Start at the obvious large pinch.   Climb up the cracks on a mixture of poor jams and layaways.

Just below the top you can gain a good rest at a hand jam.   After the jam push on through the crux moves to the anchors.
content.protection: Wires and cams.   The protection is there, just a bit fiddly.
content.location: Right side of the steep wall.

content.description:
You work between some chalked jugs on the left, and the arete on the right to start. The climb generally trends left and up using mostly face holds. Not a bad outing while at Goldilocks Wall.

There's a bit of an eliminate start option that ignores the arete beta and goes straight up. It probably ranges in the high tens, low elevens.
content.protection: TR, or maybe some gear up high if you're kind of a half-assed solo type. There's a standard bolt hanger anchor climber's left and a piton epoxied into the crack on the right. Scrambling to the anchors isn't bad but a little heads up. It looks like people have been burning their ropes across the tree up top after pulling the rappell down to the anchors - if you are going to do that, put a sling anchor around the tree so you don't damage it.
content.location: Between Mama Bear and Papa Bear is Hot Shit.

content.description: From near the lowest part of the rock, climb up the overhanging wall past flakes and flat edges. Crux comes near the top pulling up and onto a large rail.  Probably the best and most popular route on the wall.
content.location: Middle/left of wall, look for a heavily-chalked bolted line.

content.description:
Although one of the shorter climbs on the wall this packs a punch.

Start at the overhang on the leftside of the wall. Make a tricky and committing sequence of moves up to the first bolt (spotter recommended). From the bolt move up left to a good flake and the 2nd bolt. Continue direct to the break - there is a bomber .75 camalot placement on the right side of the horizontal crack.

From the break it is possible to escape left onto the large shelf, however to complete a good climb, continue directly up the arete to the anchors.
content.protection:
2 bolts and a .75 Camalot. Mussy hook anchors.

Stick clipping the first bolt is highly recommended.

content.description: This is the right facing corner on the right side of the cliff.  Short with a low crux pulling around the roof.
content.location: Furthest right route on the wall.
